name: Ref. Case Res. ASHP (RST)
_description: Standard size residential air source heat pump with reference case performance (counterfactual), non-cold-climate

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Typical air source heat pump performance in 2030, which reflects introduction of min. efficiency standard in 2023; conversion from original standard: COP = SEER / 3.412 (see second EIA source).

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation 2014

installed_cost_source.notes: Installed costs for typical ASHP in 2030, which reflects introduction of min. efficiency standard in 2023

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

product_lifetime_source.notes: Median of average typical ASHP lifetime in in 2030, which reflects introduction of min. efficiency standard in 2023

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

central AC.title: RECS 2015 - Table HC6.1
central AC.fraction_derivation: Central AC multiple of 40.5% was determined as the proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling in the sample is 76,090,522, and then filtered for homes with electric heating system (76,090,522 - 45,241,958 fuel-fired systems).

market_scaling_fractions_source.resistance heat: Applies to all homes with electric resistance furnaces (the resistance heat tech. is indicative of a forced air electric furnace in the EIA data)
